thread.title: Demonetisation: No plan to bring back Rs 1,000 notes again: Shaktikanta Das
thread.title_full: Demonetisation: No plan to bring back Rs 1,000 notes again: Shaktikanta Das

author: FE Online
title: Demonetisation: No plan to bring back Rs 1,000 notes again: Shaktikanta Das
text:
Demonetisation: No plan to bring back Rs 1,000 notes again: Shaktikanta Das Demonetisation: No plan to bring back Rs 1,000 notes again: Shaktikanta Das Economic Affairs Secretary Shaktikanta Das has today confirmed that there is no plan to introduce Rs 1,000 notes. He also added that currently the focus of the government is on production and supply of Rs 500 and lower demonetisation notes. By: FE Online | New Delhi | Published: February 22, 2017 11:18 AM Currently the focus of the government is on production and supply of Rs 500 and lower demonetisation notes. (ANI) 
Economic Affairs Secretary Shaktikanta Das has today confirmed that there is no plan to introduce Rs 1,000 notes. He also added that currently the focus of the government is on production and supply of Rs 500 and lower demonetisation notes. Taking to twittter, the economic affairs secretary also added that complaints of cash out in ATMs in several parts of the country is being looked into. In his tweet, Shaktikant Das also requested everyone to draw the cash they actually require as in several cases people are using more than actually needed, as overdrawal by some deprives others. 
Recently, some reports have suggested that after the demonetisation ban, the Rs 1,000 note is coming back in a new form, as the Reserve Bank of India ( RBI ) and the government are gearing up to bring the note back into circulation. 
Story under development
